Geal Charn (Monadhliath)

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Geal Charn is separated from the other Monadhliath Munros by several miles of rolling moorland and bogs, and is usually climbed on its own from either Garva Bridge or the Spey dam.

 You have not climbed Geal Charn (Monadhliath).

Region: Cairngorms

Altitude: 926 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.62/5
Rating: 2.6/5 (81 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Geal Charn from Garva Bridge

Other routes and challenges

The alternative route starts from the Spey Dam, and initially follows a track up the east side of Glen Markie. Higher up the route is pathless as it climbs well east of the Piper's Burn to reach the plateau and round the coire to the summit. There is a bridge over the Markie Burn around 1km upstream from the confluence with the Piper's Burn.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Kingussie / Newtonmore Hotels

Kingussie / Newtonmore B&B

Kingussie / Newtonmore cottages

Cairngorms hostels
